column2: Dear Future 3025: Chinese Intangible Culture Heritage
column4: A lively dragon, a sheet of red paper, and you: this interactive piece reimagines Chinese festival energy and folk craft as a playful digital memory sent to the futureÔºÅ

We are doomed, in an age of AI over-saturation, creativity is growing weaker and weaker and soon we will have forgotten what it was like to be human. Reclaim your humanity and bring color, life, movement, and artistry back.

It's 3025. In Forest Utopia, your body revives a forgotten forest. Birds appear at your fingertips, trees sway with your voice, and rain returns through quietness, giving you a brief glimpse into a world that nature once offered freely.
"Cultural heritage is alive. Its life lies in its transmission, in its integration into our times and into our daily lives."
Future garden created by music notes.
This is an interactive project aimed to demonstrate the moments I captured in Shanghai, my hometown. When poeple in the future see this website, what will they think of Shanghai in the 2020s?
